pfc.models
Class Graph

Show UML class diagram 
java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      pfc.models.ObservableModel
          pfc.models.Graph
Direct Known Subclasses:
DualGraph, DualPathGraph
public class Graph
extends ObservableModel

The Graph class represents the highest level data-structure in graph theory, containing—fundamentally and by definition—a list of vertices and a corresponding list of edges connecting those vertices. Presently, this class supports not only simple, undirected graphs but also graphs with loops (psuedographs), multi-edges (multigraphs), directed edges (digraphs), and every combination of the three. The Graph class also supports acyclic graphs (trees), though multi-edges and loops must then be prohibited, as they inherently form cycles.

In addition to the mathematical properties of a graph, the Graph class also includes a name property to help the user distinguish one graph from another, and a list of captions used to point out regions of interest from within the graph itself. In order for this class to be saved to file or shared through the web it must be fully serializable, and indeed is: with the toString() method used for serialization using JSON and the Graph(String) constructor used for deserialization.

As an ObservableModel, this class also supports multiple subscribing Observers. Whenever a change is made to any part of a Graph, notification of that change is automatically propagated upwards until it hits the Graph level. Be it the addition or removal of an edge or even a change to one of the properties of a single vertex, all changes below the graph will trigger an Observable.notifyObservers(Object) call.

See Also:
Vertex, UMLGraph

Field Detail

name

public final ObservableModel.Property<String> name
The name of this graph used for identification and serialization

vertices

public final List<Vertex> vertices
An ordered set of this graph's vertices, whose connecting edges are contained in this graph's edges member

edges

public final List<Edge> edges
An ordered set of this graph's edges, whose respective vertices are specified in each Edge class

tag

public final ObservableModel.Property<String> tag
A catch-all String that can be used to store this Graph's metadata

areLoopsAllowed

public final boolean areLoopsAllowed
A boolean indicating whether or not loops are allowed in this graph. A loop is an edge from a vertex to itself, and are only allowed in psuedographs.

areMultipleEdgesAllowed

public final boolean areMultipleEdgesAllowed
A boolean indicating whether or not multi-edges are allowed in this graph. Multi-edges are distinct edges that connect connect the same two vertices in the same direction, and are only allowed in multigraphs.

areDirectedEdgesAllowed

public final boolean areDirectedEdgesAllowed
A boolean indicating whether or not this graph is a directed graph, or digraph. Digraphs are graphs whose edges may only go in one direction (i.e. from A to B, but not necessarily B to A).

areCyclesAllowed

public final boolean areCyclesAllowed
A boolean indicating whether or not cycles are allowed in this graph. Trees, for instance, are by definition acyclic.

incidences

private final Map<Vertex,Set<Edge>> incidences
A Map of vertices to edge-incidence lists

elementObserver

private final Observer elementObserver
An Observer used to notify this graph's subscribed Observers of changes to any of its elements' properties

notificationsSuspended

private boolean notificationsSuspended
A boolean flag indicating whether notifications are to be sent on to any of this graph's subscribed Observers, or merely caught and handled internally

newLabelAvailable

private Integer newLabelAvailable
A Integer number that indicates the new Vertex's label available

             boolean areMultipleEdgesAllowed,

Parameters:
name - a String identifying this graph
areLoopsAllowed - a boolean indicating whether or not to allow loops in this graph
areDirectedEdgesAllowed - a boolean indicating whether or not this graph is a directed graph
areMultipleEdgesAllowed - a boolean indicating whether or not to allow multi-edges in this graph
areCyclesAllowed - a boolean indicating whether or not to allow cycles in this graph
Method Detail

areConnected

public boolean areConnected(Vertex from,
                            Vertex to)
Returns a boolean indicating whether or not there exists a path between the two vertices. Although implemented using a relatively fast algorithm, the method still has a worst-case performance of O(|E| + |V|log|V|), where E is the set of all edges in the graph, and V is the set of all vertices. Caution must therefore be used when calling this method, especially where performance is a consideration.

Parameters:
from - the vertex from which the path begins
to - the vertex at which the path ends
Returns:
true if there exists a path between the two vertices in the specified direction, false otherwise
See Also:
Vertex, Edge

getEdges

public Set<Edge> getEdges(Vertex vertex)
Returns the set of all edges incident to a given vertex. In both directed and undirected graphs this includes all edges, both from- and to-, the specified vertex.

Parameters:
vertex - the vertex to which the edges are incident
Returns:
the edges incident to the specified vertex
See Also:
Vertex, Edge

getEdges

public Set<Edge> getEdges(Vertex from,
                          Vertex to)
Returns the set of all edges going from one specified vertex to another. In a simple graph, this method will return at most one edge—in multigraphs, possibly more. Note that for digraphs and multi-digraphs, the returned set will not include edges going in the opposite direction (from to to from).

Parameters:
from - the vertex from which the edges go
to - the vertex to which the edges go
Returns:
the edges bridging the specified vertices
See Also:
Vertex, Edge

getEdgesFrom

public Set<Edge> getEdgesFrom(Vertex vertex)
Returns the set of all edges coming from a given vertex. In an undirected graph this includes all edges incident to the specified vertex. In digraphs, this includes edges from the specified vertex, but not those to it.

Parameters:
vertex - the vertex from which the edges go
Returns:
the edges going from the specified vertex
See Also:
Vertex, Edge

getEdgesTo

public Set<Edge> getEdgesTo(Vertex vertex)
Returns the set of all edges going to a given vertex. In an undirected graph this includes all edges incident to the specified vertex. In digraphs, this includes edges to the specified vertex, but not those from it.

Parameters:
vertex - the vertex to which the edges go
Returns:
the edges going to the specified vertex
See Also:
Vertex, Edge

getNeighbors

public Set<Vertex> getNeighbors(Vertex vertex)
Returns the set of all vertices that are neighbors of a given vertex. In an undirected graph, one vertex is another vertex's neighbor iff the two share at least one common edge. In digraphs, vertex A is only vertex B's neighbor if there exists and edge from B to A, regardless of how many edges exist from A to B.

Parameters:
vertex - Vertex the vertex to which the returned vertices are neighbors
Returns:
the neighbors of the specified vertex
See Also:
Vertex, Edge

getNeighborsIn

public Set<Vertex> getNeighborsIn(Vertex vertex)
Returns set of neighbors B of A if there exists and edge from B to A, regardless of how many edges exist from A to B.

Parameters:
vertex - Vertex the vertex to which the returned vertices are neighbors
Returns:
the neighbors of the specified vertex
See Also:
Vertex, Edge

selectAll

public void selectAll(boolean select)
Sets the isSelected property of all elements in this graph to true or false}, depending upon the parameter.

Parameters:
select - a boolean indicating whether to select or deselect all graph elements
See Also:
Vertex, Edge

suspendNotifications

public boolean suspendNotifications(boolean suspend)
Temporarily suspends the notification all of property changes to subscribed Observers. Most often this method is called when performing a large number of batch operations on a graph, so that subscribers are not overloaded with a multitude of notifications.

Parameters:
suspend - a boolean indicating whether to suspend or reenable notifications to subscribed Observers
Returns:
true if notifications were previously suspended, false otherwise
See Also:
ObservableModel, Observer, ObservableList

toString

public String toString()
Returns a string representation of this graph in JSON format. This method can be used to serialize a graph, which may later be deserialized using the class's string constructor. For more information on the JSON format (used throughout VisiGraph for serialization), visit here.

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
this Graph serialized as a String
See Also:
Graph(String)

translateSelected

public void translateSelected(double x,
                              double y)
Translates all elements in this graph with isSelected properties set to true by a specified offset.

Parameters:
x - the horizontal offset to be added to each selected element's location
y - the vertical offset to be added to each selected element's location
See Also:
Vertex, Edge

union

public void union(Graph graph)
Performs a set-union with the specified graph, merging the two without conflicts. Note that the ids of the specified graph's vertices will be re-assigned, so that they do not conflict with existing vertex ids.

Parameters:
graph - the graph with which to merge
